Key Match Events: Remo Freuler and Granit Xhaka manipulated Hungary’s defenders with their eyes like NFL quarterbacks.
Michel Aebischer found Kwadwo Duah for the first goal after a 22-pass move, the third-longest build-up move in a European Championship since 1980.
Breel Embolo scored Switzerland’s third and clinching goal, marking his first international appearance since the 2022 World Cup.
Post-Match Reflections: Marco Rossi said, 'It’s hard to correct the kind of mistakes that we made today. Our players do not make mistakes like this every day.'

Murat Yakin said, 'I liken football to chess, and today we got our tactics right. We used this formation for a reason. We focused on making the most of our strengths, and we made our opponents’ lives very hard in the first half.'
